<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofpr

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.75

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Environment

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>serverExec</name>=<value> server

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Set rain density smoothly over the given transition time (in seconds). A transition time of zero means an immediate change.
A rain density of zero is no rain, one is maximum rain. Rain is not possible when [[overcast]] is less than 0.7.

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3 </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Since <template><title>arma3</title></template> this command is MP synchronised:
* If executed on server, the changes will propagate globally.
* If executed on client, the effect is temporary and will soon change to the server setting.
Minimum [[overcast]] needed for rain in <template><title>arma3</title></template> is '''0.5'''.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> time [[setRain]] rain

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> time: [[Number]] - transition time to the new value in seconds

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> rain: [[Number]] - new rain value in range 0...1

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>60 [[setRain]] 1;</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Force no rain: <code>0 [[setRain]] 0;
[[forceWeatherChange]];
999999 [[setRain]] 0;</code>
</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> Pre-Arma 3, each client and the server could have different rain values.

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[overcast]], [[setOvercast]], [[rain]], [[nextWeatherChange]], [[forceWeatherChange]], [[setFog]]
</value></part></template>
